intro: Diptychandra epunctata subsp. rojasii, commonly known as the narrow-leafed diptychandra, is a member of the Malvaceae family. It is a shrub native to South America, particularly found in regions of Brazil and Peru. The plant is characterized by its narrow, lance-shaped leaves and small, clustered flowers that range in color from white to pale pink. It typically grows in moist, well-drained soils and is adapted to tropical and subtropical climates. Due to its ornamental value and unique morphology, it is occasionally cultivated in botanical gardens and by plant enthusiasts.
